page.title: 01Shepreth Village
page.content: Shepreth is a small village with a population of 670. It is mainly built around a small river and cross roads, with the houses scattered radially from this centre along the roads. The landscape surrounding is arable farm land crossed by many drainage rivers. As the soil is clay on a chalk base and very flat it is liable to flooding if not attended to regularly. Many of the older people have lived here all their lives. However the children are leaving the village to find work, and a large part of the population now is younger families, who commute to work outside the immediate area. Their attitudes however show a desire to develop activities for the population in the village and to keep a village identity.
